message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SY, cs.CV 

The paper deals with optimization methods for online, continual prediction problems, which are typically studied in the machine learning and artificial intelligence communities. The paper discusses various optimization methods, including quasi-second order methods and meta-gradient descent, which are commonly used in the field of machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also discusses the application of the proposed methods to time-series prediction problems, which are often studied in the control systems community, suggesting that cs.SY (Systems and Control) may also be a relevant sub-category. Finally, the paper includes experiments on real-world data, which may suggest a connection to cs.CV (Computer Vision) or other sub-categories related to data analysis and processing.
